remarks: The determinant function is additive for each row:  The matrices X, Y, Z are identical except for the I's row, and the I's row of the matrix X is the componentwise sum of the I's row of the matrices Y and Z. In this case the determinant of X is the sum of the determinants of Y and Z. (Contributed by SO, 9-Jul-2018.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Jul-2019.)
